#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Corruption endangers Brazilian government
#Text=Sunday , May 29 , 2005
#Text=Brazil —
#Text=Denunciations of political corruption threaten the Brazilian government .

#Text=The most recent case involves a deputy of the political party PTB ( who supports the government of the Brazilian President Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva ) in a scandal of the services of post office .
#Text=Lula 's government representatives said that they will investigate all the denunciations and affirmed that the government is a victim of political enemies .
#Text=Post office scandal
#Text=File : Marinho correios escandalo . jpg
#Text=Mauricio Marinho speaks to press after inquiry of Brazilian Federal Police .
#Text=Photo : Wilson Dias/ABr .
#Text=( Image missing from commons : image ; log )
#Text=File : Roberto Jefferson . jpeg
#Text=Deputy Roberto Jefferson ( file ) .
#Text=Photo : José Cruz - ABR ( Image missing from commons : image ; log )
#Text=Deputy Roberto Jefferson ( PTB-RJ ) is accused of directing a corrupt scheme that involves the Brazilian postal service .

#Text=The case began after Veja , a magazine , made known a 110 minute video tape recording which shows former Post Office Chief Maurício Marinho during a supposed bribe negotiation with a businessman .
#Text=In the tape , Marinho receives and puts in his pocket R$ 3,000 ( about 1,259 USD ) in cash .
#Text=He insinuates that the scheme is commanded by deputy Roberto Jefferson .
#Text=The recording was aired by the major Brazilian television stations .
#Text=A group of deputies mobilized to create a special investigation congress commission in order to investigate the denunciations .
#Text=The Brazilian government tried to prevent the creation of the Congress ' special commission
#Text=convincing some deputies not to endorse the Congress investigations commission creation , however it failed .
#Text=Now the government is trying to control how the special commissions works .
#Text=Other cases
#Text=Bingo 's scandal
#Text=File :
#Text=Waldomiro Diniz . jpg
#Text=Waldomiro Diniz ( left ) and his lawyer , Luis Guilherme Vieira ( right ) , leaving the Federal Police office .
#Text=Photo : J. Freitas/Abr .
#Text=( Image missing from commons : image ; log )

#Text=Waldomiro Diniz , former adviser to the government of President Lula , is accused of negotiating with " bicheiros " ( illegal gambling enterprises ) , traffic of influences and extortions of money for Workers ' Party ( PT ) electoral campaigns .
#Text=The case was known in 2004 after a businessman revealed a tape exposing Diniz .
#Text=The Brazilian magazine Epoca published a history on the case in February , 2004 .
#Text=The recorded audio tape by the businessman Carlos Augusto Ramos , known as Carlinhos Cachoeira , shows him supposedly being extorted by Waldomiro Diniz .
#Text=The tape 's authenticity has been verified by experts and it was aired by the major Brazilian television stations .

#Text=Waldomiro was an adviser of the Ministry of Civilian Household , directed by the Minister José Dirceu , and president of Loterj ( which administers the lotteries of the state of the Rio de Janeiro ) from February , 2001 until December , 2002 .
#Text=Mystery in mayor 's death
#Text=The ophthalmologist João Francisco Daniel , brother of the murdered Mayor Celso Daniel ( PT ) from Santo André , metropolitan area of São Paulo , said that the crime had political reasons .
#Text=According to him , some mayor 's advisers were receiving bribes from businessman .
#Text=The bribes were allegedly used to collect founds for the Worker 's Party and for self-enrichment .
#Text=The Mayor Celso Daniel has been murdered in 2002 and until now the case has not been totally solved .
#Text=At least six witnesses died in suspicious situations .
#Text=The Minister Romero Jucá

#Text=The Social Security Minister Romero Jucá has been accused of having offered seven non-existent farms as guarantee for a financing from the Banco of Amazonia , among other denunciations of misuse of public loans .
#Text=The minister attributes the accusations to political adversaries .
#Text=English
#Text=Raymond Colitt .
#Text=" Brazil launches corruption inquiry " — Financial Times , May 27 , 2005
